members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Namespace: DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Analytics Project: HttpModules Module: AnalyticsEngineConfiguration -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Class definition for AnalyticsEngineConfiguration which is used to create an AnalyticsEngineCollection
[cniknet] 05/03/2009 created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.CompressionModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.remarks: This implementation hooks the ReleaseRequestState and PreSendRequestHeaders events to figure out as late as possible if we should install the filter. Previous versions did not do this as well.
member.param: The this handler is working for.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.CompressionModule.Dispose
member.remarks: Currently empty. Nothing to really do, as I have no member variables.

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.Algorithms
member.summary: The available compression algorithms to use with the HttpCompressionModule

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.Settings
member.summary: This class encapsulates the settings for an HttpCompressionModule

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.Settings.GetSettings
member.summary: Get the current settings from the xml config file

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.Settings.IsExcludedPath(System.String)
member.summary: Looks for a given path in the list of paths excluded from compression
member.returns: true if excluded, false if not

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.Settings.PreferredAlgorithm
member.summary: The preferred algorithm to use for compression

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.CompressingFilter
member.summary: Base for any HttpFilter that performing compression
member.remarks: When implementing this class, you need to implement a along with a . The latter corresponds to a content coding (see http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.5) that your implementation will support.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.CompressingFilter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Protected constructor that sets up the underlying stream we're compressing into

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.CompressingFilter.WriteHeaders
member.summary: Writes out the compression-related headers. Subclasses should call this once before writing to the output stream.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.CompressingFilter.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The name of the content-encoding that's being implemented
member.remarks: See http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.5 for more details on content codings.

member.name: P:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.CompressingFilter.HasWrittenHeaders
member.summary: Keeps track of whether or not we're written the compression headers

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.Compression.GZipFilter
member.summary: This is a little filter to support HTTP compression using GZip

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.RequestFilter.RequestFilterModule.Dispose
member.remarks: Currently empty. Nothing to really do, as I have no member variables.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.RequestFilter.RequestFilterRule.#ctor(System.String,System.String,DotNetNuke.HttpModules.RequestFilter.RequestFilterOperatorType,DotNetNuke.HttpModules.RequestFilter.RequestFilterRuleType,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RequestFilterRule class.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.RequestFilter.RequestFilterRule.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RequestFilterRule class.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.HttpModules.RequestFilter.RequestFilterSettings.GetSettings
member.summary: Get the current settings from the xml config file
